Animation (Overview / Examples »)

animation. Animation

new Animation

The animation class stuff

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
clock EventEmitter

An object that emits a 'tick' event and has a toFrameNumber method.
duration Number | String

The duration, either as frames (number), seconds (e.g. '1s'), milliseconds (e.g. '100ms') or as a percentage of the clock's total frames (e.g. '23%')
properties Object <optional>

The properties/values to animate
options Object <optional>

Additional options

Properties
Name Type Argument Default Description
easing String | Function <optional>

Easing function. Either the name of a predefined or a custom function
timelineBound Boolean <optional>

Boolean indicating whether this animation should be bound to the timeline, and respond to isPlaying state, or play regardless of timeline's progress.
subject Object <optional>

The subject (e.g. a DisplayObject) of the animation
strategy string | Object <optional>
 'attr'

The strategy to use to get and set properties on the subject.
delay Number | String <optional>

Delay before animation begins, in frames or seconds // TODO: implement
repeat Number <optional>
 0

The number of repetitions. - 0: The animation is played once - 1: The animation is played two times (one repetition) - Infinity: The animation is repeated endlessly
Returns:

An Animation instance

Type
Animation

Mixes In

  • EventEmitter

Methods

addSubject

Adds a subject with given strategy to the animation

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
subject Object

The subject (usually a DisplayObject)
strategy mixed <optional>
 'attr'

The set/get strategy to use - 'attr': The 'attr' method of the object is used (for DisplayObjects) - 'prop': Normal property setting and getting is used - Object with 'set(subject, values)' and 'get(subject)' methods.

addSubjects

Adds multiple subjects with given strategy to the animation

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
subjects Array

Array of subjects to add
strategy mixed <optional>
 'attr'

The set/get strategy to use - 'attr': The 'attr' method of the object is used (for DisplayObjects) - 'prop': Normal property setting and getting is used - Object with 'set(subject, values)' and 'get(subject)' methods.

clone

Clones the current animation.

Returns:

The clone

Type
Animation

pause

Halts the animation.

Returns:
Type
this

play

Starts or resumes the animation.

Optionally changes the subject of the animation.

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
subject Object <optional>
strategy mixed <optional>
 'attr'

The set/get strategy to use - 'attr': The 'attr' method of the object is used (for DisplayObjects) - 'prop': Normal property setting and getting is used - Object with 'set(subject, values)' and 'get(subject, propertyNames)' methods.
Returns:
Type
this

removeSubject

Removes a subject with given strategy to the animation

Parameters:
Name Type Description
subject Object

The subject to remove

removeSubjects

Removes a subject with given strategy to the animation

Parameters:
Name Type Description
subjects Array

Array of subjects to remove

reset

Reset an animation

Returns:
Type
this

setSubject

Sets the subject of the animation while wiping all current subjects

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
subject Object
strategy mixed <optional>
 'attr'

The set/get strategy to use - 'attr': The 'attr' method of the object is used (for DisplayObjects) - 'prop': Normal property setting and getting is used - Object with 'set(subject, values)' and 'get(subject)' methods.

setSubjects

Sets the subjects of the animation while wiping all current subjects

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
subject Object
strategy mixed <optional>
 'attr'

The set/get strategy to use - 'attr': The 'attr' method of the object is used (for DisplayObjects) - 'prop': Normal property setting and getting is used - Object with 'set(subject, values)' and 'get(subject)' methods.
Returns:
Type
this

step

A single step in an animation

Parameters:
Name Type Description
progress number

Progress between 0 and 1
